WRITING.TEXT:
This video made me think of an opinion that was last posted here 3 months ago so I'll just say it here.
Would it be for the better to separate the T from LGB?
If you actually go through the comments, there's little homophobia, it's more of a queer hate.
I believe it's kind of a general opinion that the video could have gone smoother, society still has a not-so-easy time accepting homosexuality, and Youtube went fullforce depicting all of the sexual spectrum.
It just generated a backlash to have so many things in the same bag, and I'm left thinking that it WOULD have been better if it was just LGB for now. Would have been easily accepted, setting a positive precedent, especially due to recent events.
LGB was kinda close to being normalized for the western society but that video pushed all of the right buttons to reinforce hateful opinions of people who were unsure about what side they were standing in.
Besides, wouldn't their problems have different approaches? Again, I don't really see people perceiving them all as the same, it's the T that stands out whenever something of this kind comes up. Talk about efficiency.

Well that was a wise comment, I underestimated my audience
This is a loss

Yes but that video just came out today and it's the new punching bag.
Besides not everyone on Reddit knows the joke.

WRITING.TITLE: Will the lack of blood last forever on DBS?
WRITING.TEXT:
On the first sagas one could handwave as it being a lighthearted series, with humor and stuff. Even Resurrection of F was mainly comedy.
But by this last episode I'm pretty sure we should have returned to the good old days. The tone is darker and they were acting as if a character was dying, but there wasn't a single red mark.
I believe it would have made it so much better to just put some bloodied forehead or a thin stream from the mouth. The fighting now is really good but it could still use a better battle damage. Said character also coughed up some white liquid when kicked in the gut. It looks like American censorship but it's the original.

Well that was a dumb thing to do.

That thing is really tricky, usually people talk that way on the internet so it's a dangerous tool to make it illegal. If anyone feels like it they would get you in problems.
I guess I'm leaning more towards the online harassment thing as everyone can join. Someone harasses you, you harass back. Both sides can do it.

Well I guess that's correct. I still think it's not set in stone that this is serious, because most people wouldn't really feel in danger by empty words. These "I will X" on the internet are just another form of insult, like saying "idiot".
But yeah maybe the wording matters, gotta be more indirect then. I can see someone getting a lucky shot and taking legal action against someone and the only defense would be "But I didn't really mean it", which doesn't really help.

It's because intent isn't known from just words on a screen, there's a difference with real life.
Here, "I will punch/rape your skull if you don't upvote me". That may be considered a threat by someone but 99% of time it's just harmless, being said with no ulterior motives.
Very different to being close to someone or calling them by phone to say that.

WRITING.TITLE: STOP DEHUMANIZING BROCK TURNER, HE COULD BE ANY OF YOU OR YOUR FRIENDS, HE WAS JUST SOME COLLEGE STUDENT [Massive Rant]
WRITING.TEXT:
So, for those of you who want to know what's this all about, is that some guy named Brock Turner raped a girl on a campus party. That's a pretty common story, one of the oldest on the book, but this one gained global attention on par with ISIS.
Going through lots of comments on Reddit, it's actually impossible to try and swim against the flow of hate. And I came to realize, this is exactly what was done to Hitler.
I believe most level-headed people have realized by now, that dehumanizing Hitler, to the point that his name sounds like a random word and not a person's name, was a mistake.
General public seems to think they are not capable of great evil, because, hey, no one's evil. There was Hitler, but he isn't human is he? He's some twisted monster, born from darkness or something. It's not like he had a set of beliefs, a family, things he enjoyed and mundane activities like us.
Or at least that's what people used to thought. Right now, I see everyone talking about how he was a normal human just like us, someone who could be our friend or annoying neighbor, a functioning man of society and not someone who just had a mental illness. Society has come to accept that at least murderers are normal people and whoever of us can be the next one if we take some wrong steps.
And that's a recurring theme I've found while researching rape in the past. People think they aren't capable of it, because that's something scary men with trenchcoats and hats do, following their prey through the night.
Well, now Brock Turner had a "party accident", one of the most classic rape types, and ended up doing a girl behind a dumpster. What do we get?
Millions of people lashing out at the first set of news where it stated how good of a swimmer he was and how he was a college student.
If you search his name on Reddit and look at the news, people already fucked up. They completely dismiss his family and friends trying to protect him and talk about how he is some kind of demon.
As if he had no thoughts, no motivations, no background, nothing. He's just the devil and rapes people, he's being equated to the worst of the worst already and there's people gloating about wanting to kill some 19 yrs old. Like jesus fucking christ, that's younger than me and I still feel like a child.
He did one of the most default rapes but people already sent that away to the Valhalla of crimes and now I'm sure that someone, somewhere, will do some kind of minor sexual assault but be reassured "Hey, at least I'm not Brock Turner, I'm not raping anyone behind a dumpster. This is fine, I'm not that monster"
All thanks to the hivemind who elevated him to some implausible status while he's just some college sports player. I believe empathy, not sympathy, was something necessary to understand this kind of behaviour and speak about it, not good ol' torches and pitchforks.

I thought I was clear. Right now, his name is known worldwide, everyone hates Brock Turner.
I'm sure someone has the ability to give new identities to people for their safety, and I'm not sure if this guy can function in society as it is now.
It would be the best way to end this storm.
Since his face is the same he'd probably need to go to Europe or some other state where he isn't that known, tho.

Why can't the police just give him a new identity?
Like those kids back then who killed a 3 years old, they got new identities so their lives weren't in danger
It's shit how now everyone knows his name, you can't live like that. If I were him, I'd shoot whoever published so much data

You're just acting like kids throwing more stones at a dead bird for the hell of it. "Yeah he's bad so we can forget about humanity" We fucking got rid of death sentence because we aknowledged that wasn't a good thought process.
But there's no need to keep fucking with the poor guy for something which doesn't really matter on the big scheme of things. No one got killed nor was going to, no real collateral damage. It would have been better if no one stopped him, someone would take her to the hospital the next day and she wouldn't have gone through this. If all of the damage mostly came from it being published, then it wasn't a big crime to begin with. She would have stopped going to parties because of fear of that happening again, but that's it.
Where the hell is the empathy? I can put myself on his shoes but apparently no one else does. It makes my blood boil to see people cheering like animals on the worst fate someone can get, to be alive but excluded. Urges are weird like that and a party doesn't make it easier, of all the people cheering against him, some would have done the same if presented with the same opportunity.
There should surely be "tiers" or something, not all crime is equal. Even if both are sexual assault, some dude fingering a sleeping lady is not the same as some psycho with a hockey mask raping her while she's tied and screaming for her life on some abandoned cabin.
But what can I say, in America you even get to be registered as a sex offender for taking a piss on the forest. People don't really care about tiers.

And all of this shit just because of 20 minutes of action.
